message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CY 

This paper deals with the task of identifying fake news, which is a common problem in natural language processing and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also leverages emotion intensity lexicons to develop emotionized text representations, which is a technique used in sentiment analysis and falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI). The paper also evaluates the utility of the emotional information in news articles, which is a task related to information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper uses supervised and unsupervised scenarios to evaluate the proposed technique, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper deals with the problem of identifying fake news in the health domain, which is a specific application area and falls under the category of cybernetics (cs.CY).
